1604066359_mirrored_guahunyo_github.body: 路由器打不开，找路由器开发商。

这个原因应该是和ISP 有关的， 就是和你互联网服务商（电信、移动、联通、长城宽带等）有关，国内的ISP 大都只是给你局域网地址，让你能上网。就好比 ISP 有一个路由器， 它发了一个局域网地址给你的路由器，你的路由器再发一个局域网地址给你的电脑，你虽然开启了你的路由的UPNP,但是你无法保证ISP的路由器的UPNP也可开启了，所以你就打开不了15441端口。
国外的ISP一般都是给公网地址给你的路由器的，所以在国外，只要打开你的路由器的UPNP就可以成功打开15441端口。
（以上纯粹是一个来自非计算机专业人员的臆测，不保证正确）

Aslo, I know the reason why the big files can not tranfer to others well. Because the ISP (in china) just assigns a local ip address to us, although we can access the internet service. For BT transmission in ZeroNet, only the public ip address can be useful. So if nobody with a public ip address access your new site, other people only having the local ip address could not get your new site.

1604066495_mirrored_tangdou1_github.body:
However, I can not add a web game, made by RPGMAKERMV, to ZeroNet. Because it need support "$" and "!" in the file name for special use.
```
Characters (img/characters)
    Images shown for the characters on the map.
    The size for a character image can be changed freely (normally 48x48), and consist of 4 directions (down, left, right, up) and 3 patterns for a total of 12 patterns that will be arranged in the provided order. A file for 1 character will be arranged into 2 rows and 4 columns equaling 8 images. The size of the character will be calculated using 1/12 of the width and 1/8 of the height of this file. Moreover, characters will be shown 6 pixels above tile so that they appear more natural when on top of buildings.

        It is possible treat 1 character as 1 file by including "$" at the beginning of the file name.
        Including a "!" at the beginning of the file name will prevent the image from being shifted 6 pixels and will no longer appear half transparent by bush elements. This is primarily used for objects found in the map such as doors and treasure chests.
        It is also possible to use the "$" and "!" special characters together.
```
I test it. It can not load js file in zip. So still need the file name support more charaters.

1604066644_mirrored_tangdou1_github.body:
A implementation road:

1.The server-help funciton is only valid for users having public ip address, and those opening this server-help function should have a feature flag.

2.The client function is only valid for poor users without any public ip address, and these users send their passive public ip and port (and also their host sites) to those good users opening this server-help function and having public ip.

3.Those users opening this server-help function keep a pool for saving those poor users without public ip.

4.When one poor user (A) want to send text message to one site of the zeronet, it will ask its connected good users. And the good users will check the pool for finding those poor users (C D F ..) which also host the site of the zeronet, and give their passive public ip to poor user A, and also give a notice (including the passive public ip and port) to those users (C D F ...).

Reference 
https://github.com/ntop/n2n

Introduction for N2N

n2n is a layer-two peer-to-peer virtual private network (VPN) which allows users to exploit features typical of P2P applications at network instead of application level. This means that users can gain native IP visibility (e.g. two PCs belonging to the same n2n network can ping each other) and be reachable with the same network IP address regardless of the network where they currently belong. In a nutshell, as OpenVPN moved SSL from application (e.g. used to implement the https protocol) to network protocol, n2n moves P2P from application to network level.

The main n2n design features are:

    An n2n is an encrypted layer two private network based on a P2P protocol.
    Encryption is performed on edge nodes using open protocols with user-defined encryption keys: you control your security without delegating it to companies as it happens with Skype or Hamachi.
    Each n2n user can simultaneously belong to multiple networks (a.k.a. communities).
    Ability to cross NAT and firewalls in the reverse traffic direction (i.e. from outside to inside) so that n2n nodes are reachable even if running on a private network. Firewalls no longer are an obstacle to direct communications at IP level.
    n2n networks are not meant to be self-contained: it is possible to route traffic across n2n and non-n2n networks.

The n2n architecture is based on two components:

    edge nodes: applications installed on user PCs that allow the n2n network to be build. Practically each edge node creates a tun/tap device that is then the entry point to the n2n network.

    an supernode: it is used by edge nodes at startup or for reaching nodes behind symmetrical firewalls. This application is basically a directory register and a packet router for those nodes that cannot talk directly.

1604067247_mirrored_tangdou1_github.body: maybe it is just a python version problem. (Debian 9 use python 2.7.13)

> 
> 
> What happens if you open the `http://remote zeronet's ip:port/14c5LUN73J7KKMznp9LvZWkxpZFWgE1sDz/fonts/material-icons/MaterialIcons-Regular.woff` directly? Does the file content got displayed?

@HelloZeroNet 
It will be downloaded directly.

[MaterialIcons-Regular.zip](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/files/3016080/MaterialIcons-Regular.zip)

It may be just the problem of python version. 
When I change from Debian 9 (python 2.7.13) to Debian 8 (python 2.7.9), the bug disappears.

> 
> 
> I just tested with python 2.7.9 (Linux), 2.7.13 (Linux), 2.7.14 (Win), 3.5.3 (Linux), 3.7.1 (Win) and the result is the same everywhere:
> 
> ```
> $ python -c "print(__import__('mimetypes').guess_type('hello.woff2'))"
> (None, None)
> ```
> 
> In this case ZeroNet should return "application/octet-stream" as content type. Whats your result to this command?

In Debian 9 (python 2.7.13)
It return `(None, None)`  when input `python -c "print(__import__('mimetypes').guess_type('hello.woff2'))"`.
It return `('application/font-woff', None)` when input `python -c "print(__import__('mimetypes').guess_type('MaterialIcons-Regular.woff'))"`.
However, in browser, it shows:
![pic](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35254744/55270720-475c6b80-52dd-11e9-9b3e-b00f29b96abf.png)

it is the font itself, shown in:

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35254744/55283698-79cc9e00-539b-11e9-9bed-f3e8cf257da7.png)

>  on python 3.7.2. Here's what I get for these:

When I use the python3 version of zeronet (rev 4033) on the same machine, the content-type problem also disappears. This is just a python's problem (python 2.7.13 on Debian 9) not a zeronet's bug.
So just close this issue.
When enable the ui_password plugin , the problem will reproduce .

topic.title: IPV6 Supports
topic.body:
IPV6 Supports: 
(If you donot have ipv6, these change would not change the logic of your code. If you have public ipv6, these change would let you choose ipv6 as your connection server first (can let the users to choose if needed ), not your public ipv4 address, in which you can also connect these ipv4 peers and ipv4 trackers. )

- [x] UDP/TCP Trackers Supports

- [x] Peer Exchange Supports

- [x] BigFile Supports

- [x] Bootstrapper Supports

- [x] Testing

topic.title: IPV6 Supports in the smallest code change
topic.body:
If you can not wait the official ipv6 support, you can use ipv6 version directly replacing the core code (see: zihu.bit/?Topic:1537342516_1K7tW4WEbso38uMs4RN3W7GihA6tTqrApz/+IPV6) (And I delete the original source in github because zeronet would transfer to Python3 and many codes would change, this PR would be just a reference for Python3.)
IPV6 Supports: 
(If you donot have ipv6, these change would not change the logic of your code. If you have public ipv6, these change would let you choose ipv6 as your connection server first (can let the users to choose if needed ), not your public ipv4 address, in which you can also connect these ipv4 peers and ipv4 trackers. )

- [x] UDP/TCP Trackers Supports

- [x] Peer Exchange Supports

- [x] BigFile Supports

- [x] Bootstrapper Supports

- [x] Tested in real condition

topic.title: Bootstrapper nodes as relay server
Limit maximum optional file size for proxies
Update zh.json
Limit feature of optional file of one zite in sidebar.
topic.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

When I help to distribute the optional file of Millchan in one vps with 10 GB free space and I donot know how many optional files would be downloaded into my VPS (the default vaule for big file is 1MB), hours later, I found more than 8 GB optional files of Millchan were downloade into my VPS and they were increasing, I have to delete this zite because this zite would use up all of my free space. I just wanted to help download some new optional file of this zite and the total size of optional flie of this zite should be limited into 1 GB. However, when I click the help to distribute button, more than 8 GB optional files were downloaded into my vps.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I wish there is a choice in the sidebar that would limit the maximum size of optional files of that zite.

topic.title: Delete muted users data files
topic.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I know that there still are the content of the guy who I muted in zeronet in my PC, although I cannot see them. But you know that it's dangerous when the illegal content that is published by the guys who I muted still lives in my PC.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I know it is difficult to delete the text content of the muted guy because that would break the integrity of zites. However,  in concept, it is possible to delete all the downloaded optional files of those muted guy and never help them distribute new optional files of those muted guy in all my served zites.

topic.title: Fix a bug
Update zh.json
ipv4 opened when recheck port
topic.body:
rev.3818

Problem:
I donot have public ipv4, it will show `ipv4 closed` in the first start. Because 
` PeerPortchecker Checking port 23144 (ipv4) using checkCanyouseeme result: {'ip': 'xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx', 'opened': False}`
However, when I recheck port in the Hello page, it show `ipv4 opened`. Because
`ConnServer Server port opened based on configuration ipv4: True, ipv6: True`

Cause:

The `config.ip_external` will save my external ipv4 address.

```
    def portCheck(self):
        if config.ip_external:
            for ip_external in config.ip_external:
                SiteManager.peer_blacklist.append((ip_external, self.port))  # Add myself to peer blacklist

            ip_external_types = set([helper.getIpType(ip) for ip in config.ip_external])
            res = {
                "ipv4": "ipv4" in ip_external_types,
                "ipv6": "ipv6" in ip_external_types
            }
            self.port_opened.update(res)
            self.log.info("Server port opened based on configuration ipv4: %s, ipv6: %s" % (res["ipv4"], res["ipv6"]))
            return res
```

topic.title: Update SidebarPlugin.py for site having a lot of optional file
a bug?
sitePause & siteResume are also important settings
A bug about content-type?
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 3860
  * Operating system: `remote zeronet on Debian9` / `local zeronet on windows 7`
  * Web browser: _firefox66
  * Tor status: not available
  * Opened port: yes
  * Special configuration: _no___

### Step 2: Describe the problem:

#### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Open the zite `http://127.0.0.1:43110/14c5LUN73J7KKMznp9LvZWkxpZFWgE1sDz/` through `local` ZeroNet
  2. Press F12, you can find the content-type of `http://127.0.0.1:43110/14c5LUN73J7KKMznp9LvZWkxpZFWgE1sDz/fonts/material-icons/MaterialIcons-Regular.woff2` is `application/octet-stream`.
  3.  However, Open the zite `http://remote zeronet's ip:port/14c5LUN73J7KKMznp9LvZWkxpZFWgE1sDz/` through `remote` ZeroNet.
 4. Press F12, you can find the content-type of `http://remote zeronet's ip:port/14c5LUN73J7KKMznp9LvZWkxpZFWgE1sDz/fonts/material-icons/MaterialIcons-Regular.woff2` is `text/html; charset=utf-8`, which means the font source would be blocked by browser due to cors problem and the content-type is also wrong.

#### Observed Results:

 Some source cannot be read when using remote zeronet.

#### Expected Results:

the content-type should be consistent.

topic.title: Update UiServer.py
Update TrayiconPlugin.py
Update README.md
Update TrayiconPlugin.py for IPV6 compatibility
ipv6 compatibility
Update SidebarPlugin.py for better showing
Change default value to 10MB
topic.body:
Big File is an optional file which is bigger than 10MB, so the default value should be at least 10MB, which means the effect for setting this value to any number that is lower than 10 is the same as the one with 10MB.
When I open this toggle `Download and help distribute all files` in the side bar, all the small optional files (lower than 10MB) will be downloaded no matter the value of `Auto download big file size limit` is 1MB or 10MB. It will give a misunderstanding that why the optional file that is even bigger than 1MB  is also downloaded, when the `..file size limit` value is just 1MB. (Because the value is only valid for big file which is bigger than 10MB). For eliminating misconception, so the default value should be 10MB.
